101.description: Robotic Process Automation is slowly taking notice by businesses to supplement the existing workforce. This presentation will go over the basics of RPA and the tools required by developers to implement RPA in a business environment.
101.title: RPA Development

102.description: Can I make a useful bot based on my tweets? I hope so. In this session I explore a strategy to help me derive more value from Twitter by performing analysis on my activity on twitter and making recommendations based on that activity.
102.title: The TweetWhisperer

103.description: I will be talking about my 4 year career working remotely for four major US companies. The tools and strategies I have used to level up from a technical standpoint to be able to land these roles and how each and everyone can leverage the ever-changing distributed work arena.
103.title: Remote : How Distributed Work Allowed Me To Level Up As a Mobile Engineer

104.description: Flutter is a new UI toolkit developed by Google and the open-source community. It can be used for writing mobile apps, websites and desktop applications.  In this session, we will look at the fundamentals of Flutter and learn the basics of building an app that can be deployed to multiple platforms.
104.title: Hello Flutter

105.description: Today, many developers are developing their applications using microservices instead of one monolithic application base. We are going to discuss what microservices are and the advantages and disadvantages of implementing them.
105.title: The Microservice architecture

106.description: A panel discussion on the topic: of what the wants and needs of local sotfware developers. We want to highlight issues such as facilities, job opportunities, work environments, barriers to monetizing applications and general entrepreneurship.
106.title: Panel Discussion: Challenges of Local & Regional Developers

109.description: Official start of the conference. Greetings from the organizers, sponsors and partners.
109.title: GDG DevFest Por-of-Spain 2019 Opening

obika_gellineau.bio: Several conferences. I presented at the last GDG DevFest
obika_gellineau.name: Obika Gellineau
obika_gellineau.shortBio: Security Professional with over 8 years of experience in IT, Cybersecurity, Forensics and Software Development.
obika_gellineau.title: Manager

irwin_williams.bio: Spoke at last GDG. Talk at office (a lot)
irwin_williams.name: Irwin Williams
irwin_williams.shortBio:
Irwin has been a professional software developer for more than 16 years. He’s currently the Chief Software Engineer at Teleios Systems in Trinidad & Tobago.  He lectures from time to time at local universities, drawing from his experiences across life to weave technology lessons that are sometimes insightful and most times practical. Irwin is a member of the Global Communications and Technology Team of Congress WBN, a faith-based organization that spans the globe, where he provides insights in software architecture and development support on a diverse set of human-development initiatives. 
Irwin and his wife have two beautiful daughters who teach him every day that the journey is best when it is shared.
irwin_williams.title: Chief Software Engineer

joel_dean.name: Joel Alexander Dean
joel_dean.shortBio:
A seasoned Software Architect and Device Magician, Joel Dean is Jamaica’s very own tech mogul in the making. At 26 years old, he boasts over 10 years of experience building applications for iPhones, Android phones and computers. Joel has built several tech startups and lead Android development efforts, providing solutions even in the most remote areas of the world. He has managed one of the world’s largest data collection platforms, deployed to more than 50 countries, in 40 languages, for more than 1.5 million users and is now a Software Engineer at Automattic, the owner of the popular blogging platform WordPress that has over 75 million active websites reach over a billion users per month. His expertise has reached Google, Facebook, Apple, Red Cross and the World Health Organization. 

Joel is a proud graduate of the Northern Caribbean University and the May Pen High and Preparatory Schools. 10 years ago, as he walked across this very stage, he left with a high school diploma and a determination to follow his dreams. His unique story of triumph over adversity, lead to his feature interview on the Jamaican talk show Profile, made popular by the late Ian Boyne. 

Joel Dean is an active member of the World Economic Forum’s Global Shapers, a community organization that brings the brightest minds together to solve the world’s toughest problems. He is also the lead organizer for the Google Developers Group Kingston. His passion for youth development has lead him to become a mentor to young men and women who are interested in pursuing a career in the space of technology. His initiative, “Code for Cause” will see him going into high schools across Central Jamaica to speak to how technology, when used to its fullest advantage, transforms the expectations and possibilities for our youth, our country and our future.
joel_dean.title: Software Engineer

nevash_ramdial.bio:
Neevash is the lead editor of Flutter Community Medium, co-owner of the official Flutter Community Slack, author, and co-host of  #HumpDayQandA. 

He's worked with Flutter experts from around the world, including the United State, United Kingdom, Germany, and Argentina. 

When he's not writing apps and breaking code, Nash enjoys swimming, aviation, and gaming.
nevash_ramdial.name: Neevash Ramdial

nevash_ramdial.title: Software Engineer

obika_gellineau.bio: Obika is a security professional with over 8 years of experience involving Forensics, Criminal Investigations and Information Technology. He has worked for both public and private institutions in Trinidad and Tobago and has been instrumental in the the development and implementation of various IT projects within the financial industry. He currently designs and develops cybersecurity programs for various clients with the aim of providing innovative solutions.
obika_gellineau.name: Obika Gellineau

kyle_de_freitas.bio: Kyle E. DeFreitas is a PhD Student and Instructor of Computer Science in the Department of Computing and Information Technology of the University of the West Indies. He has worked with a number of local and regional organizations including CARICOM and UNDP on various developmental challenges such as HIV, Youth in Crime and Poverty. Kyle continues his work by finding opportunities of using available datasets and analytics techniques to help agencies and organizations make better decisions in their social development work and programmes.
